abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Early Childhood
            Education Project for Dominican Republic were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            Pedagogical Groups have greatly enhanced the quality of
            pre-primary education, and serve an important function where
            there is low capacity. Broad participation of different
            stakeholders and institutions contributes to stronger
            ownership of policies and processes. Fostering a culture of
            evaluation is important for sustainability. Adequate
            assessment of risks allows mitigation measures to be
            incorporated into project design. In projects with a heavy
            civil works component, careful consideration of the design
            of bidding documents and the selection of procurement method
            is critical to smooth implementation. Timely recording of
            mission findings in the Implementation Status Report (ISR)
            is important to ensure that bank management is well aware of
            implementation bottlenecks.
